folder: Poppy Joe Island Beach, Staten Island, N.Y.
text:
Poppy Joe Island Beach (Staten Island): Shown are "Dick" Williams (mail carrier for thirty-five years in New York City until picked up dead in the street with his mail sack on his shoulder) and Louis Stroud going after weakfish. They are approaching a foot bridge over New Creek. Poppy Joe Island Beach is on the Lower New York Bay between Midland Beach and Ocean Breeze..

About 1911

Photo by J.E. Davis
Copied by P. L. Sperr
title: Staten Island - Poppy Joe Island Beach - [Stroud place.]

folder: Poppy Joe Island Beach, Staten Island, N.Y.
text:
Poppy Joe Island Beach (Staten Island): A scene on the Stroud place, near New Creek. Shown are John ("Jeff") Davis, Louis Stroud, George Stroud, and his daughter Edna.

About 1911

Photo By J. E. Davis
Copied by P. L. Sperr
title: Staten Island - Poppy Joe Island Beach - [Stroud place.]

folder: Poppy Joe Island Beach, Staten Island, N.Y.
text:
Poppy Joe Island Beach (Staten Island): Hunting dogs on the Stroud place, near New Creek, where muskrat hunting was not only a pastime, but also a profitable venture.

About 1911

Photo by J. E. Davis
Copied by P. L. Sperr
title: Staten Island - Poppy Joe Island Beach - [Stroud place.]

folder: Poppy Joe Island Beach, Staten Island, N.Y.
text:
Poppy Joe Island Beach (Staten Island): A group of local muskrat hunters and hunting dogs in front of their work-and-storage barn. From left to right they are: Louis Stroud, George W. Stroud, John ("Jeff") Davis, and James A. Stroud. Poppy Joe Island is on the Lower New York Bay, near New Creek, between Ocean Breeze and Midland Beach.

About 1911

Photo by J.E. Davis
Copied by P. L. Sperr
title: Staten Island - Poppy Joe Island Beach - [Stroud place.]

folder: Poppy Joe Island Beach, Staten Island, N.Y.
text:
Poppy Joe Island Beach (Staten Island): Shown are three natives of this sparsely inhabited section of Staten Island, located between Midland Beach and Ocean Breeze, near New Creek. From left to right they are: "Dick" Williams (for thirty-five years mail carrier in New York City until picked up dead in the street with his mail sack on his shoulder), James Alexander Stroud, and John ("Jeff") Davis.

About 1911

Photo by J.E. Davis
Copied by P. L. Sperr
title: Staten Island - Poppy Joe Island Beach - [Stroud place.]

August 25, 1929

text:
Ocean Breeze (Staten Island): Looking west along the Lower New York Bay shore from near the mouth of New Creek. Note pontoon bridge and sandsucker, in the background.

P.L. Sperr

Another view in the same direction, toward Midland Beach, showing boardwalk construction.

P.L. Sperr

Looking east along the beach.

P.L. Sperr
